item.title: sport psychology: mind to perform
item.description: i’m starting to understand the idea of sport psychology, seems like a variety of techniques to help an athlete to handle mental challenges. the main techniques i have read about and found useful are: visualization visualize the outcome you want while you rehearse your performance in your head make sure you see the event as how you want it to unfold if image turns negative, stop the mental tape use all your senses from a first-person perspective visualize in detail self-talk goal setting reflection this idea of mental training is fascinating, specially when you are young and you think that you have all the pressure of the world on your shoulders.
